instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00134: What is 820-00134? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not spinning
threads.message: a customer tried to replace the thermal paste and mangled the pins on the cpu socket.  I know that on some of the 2015 apple laptops, the fan doesn't stay spinning all the time.  Do the fans on the 2015 imac spin continually or no?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not spinning
threads.message:
Not sure.
Run a graphics stress test and see if starts...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not spinning
threads.message: yeah fans are supposed to run upon starting the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not spinning
threads.message: is there a way to tell which temp sensor is malfunctioning on the 2015 imac?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not spinning
threads.message: When an iMac is open, HDD and LCD temp sensors are the first suspects.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00134</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan not spinning
threads.message: the fan was bad and <TRANSISTOR>Q5675</TRANSISTOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5675</CAPACITOR> had been knocked off the board
